The RBC lysis by bacterial hemolysin is measured as described<sub>1</sub> with modification.
Collect the RBCs into heparinized tubes.
2. Wash the RBC two times by gentle resuspension with 10 times volume of pyrogen free saline \(0.9% NaCl), and centrifugation at 1000 x g for 10 min at room temperature.
Gently resuspend the RBC pellet with pyrogen free saline and dilute the RBC to 0.8% \(v/v).
4. Culture the bacteria under test according to protocol #4, and adjust the population to 10<sup>7</sup> cfu/ml.
5. Incubate the washed RBC with equal volume of bacteria at room temperature under steady rotation at 6 rpm.
6. Set up pyrogen-free saline \(0.9%) as the negative control, and 1% Triton-X100 in saline as the positive control.
At time intervals, retrieve aliquots of the reaction mixture and pellet the RBC by centrifuging at 1000 x g for 10 min at room temperature.
8. Transfer the supernatant into 96 well microtitre plate.
Monitor the absorbance at 404 nm with ELISA-reader as an indication of the hemoglobin released into the supernatant.
